chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
B: lattice
s: Pred (A -> B)
p: A -> B

Goal:
p \In s -> p <== fun_sup s

Premises:
fun_sup = fun (s : Pred (A -> B)) (x : A) => sup [Pred p | exists f : A -> B, f \In s /\ p = f x] : Pred (A -> B) -> A -> B
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> seq A -> Prop
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
pair_supP : forall (A B : lattice) (s : Pred (A * B)) (p : A * B), p \In s -> p <== pair_sup s
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [A : Type B : lattice s : Pred (A -> B) p : A -> B |- Type] ?T' : [A : Type B : lattice s : Pred (A -> B) p : A -> B |- Type] ?f : [A : Type B : lattice s : Pred (A -> B) p : A -> B |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [A : Type B : lattice s : Pred (A -> B) p : A -> B |- ?T'] ?s : [A : Type B : lattice s : Pred (A -> B) p : A -> B |- seq ?T]
pair_supM : forall (A B : lattice) (s : Pred (A * B)) (p : A * B), (forall q : A * B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> pair_sup s <== p
relaxP : forall (T : poset) (P1 P2 : T), P1 <== P2 -> forall p : T, p <== P1 -> p <== P2
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
Image' : forall A B : Type, Pred A -> (A -> B) -> Pred B
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
Im_mem : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (a : A), b = f a -> a \In P -> image_spec P f b
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
image_spec_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (P0 : Prop), (forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> P0) -> image_spec P f b -> P0
image_spec_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (P0 : SProp), (forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> P0) -> image_spec P f b -> P0
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
fun_leq : forall (A : Type) (B : poset), (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop
pair_sup : forall A B : lattice, Pred (A * B) -> A * B
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments snd {A B}%type_scope
Znumtheory.prime_intro : forall p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) p -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) n /\ BinInt.Z.lt n p -> Znumtheory.rel_prime n p) -> Znumtheory.prime p
Image_mem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (P : Pred A) (x : A), x \In P -> f x \In [Image f i | i <- P]
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
infM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> x <== y) -> x <== inf s
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
infP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), x \In s -> inf s <== x
comp = fun (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (g : C -> B) (x : C) => f (g x) : forall A B C : Type, (B -> A) -> (C -> B) -> C -> A Arguments comp {A B C}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ /
pairPoset = fun A B : poset => Poset.Pack {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |} (A * B) : poset -> poset -> poset
Inductive prime (p : BinNums.Z) : Prop := prime_intro : BinInt.Z.lt (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) p -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) n /\ BinInt.Z.lt n p -> Znumtheory.rel_prime n p) -> Znumtheory.prime p Arguments Znumtheory.prime _%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.prime_intro _%Z_scope _ _%function_scope
Inductive image_spec (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) : Prop := Im_mem : forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> image_spec P f b Arguments image_spec [A B]%type_scope _ _%function_scope Arguments Im_mem [A B]%type_scope [P] [f]%function_scope [b a]
toPred : forall (T : Type) (p : PredType T), p -> Pred T
pairLattice = fun A B : lattice => Lattice.Pack {| Lattice.base := {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |}; Lattice.mixin := pairLatticeMixin A B |} (A * B) : lattice -> lattice -> lattice
Image_inj_eqmem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] =p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 =p X2
Image_inj_sub : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] <=p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 <=p X2
@sval : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
